post_content:
📌 2.5 Years Since ChatGPT: A Look at What’s Changed and What’s Next

It was just over 2.5 years ago — November 30, 2022 — that ChatGPT launched. I remember the day after when Chris Dulny messaged me and said
“This is powerful. Let’s get to work on what it means us.”

Since then, we’ve seen Generative AI transform how we work, how we lead, how we create — and yes, how we plan Tuesday night tacos.

I took a look back at the past 2.5 years of AI transformation and summarized the key themes, signals, and what they may mean for the future. Here's what’s changed, what it signals — and what’s next (especially for Canada 🇨🇦).

TL;DR
If you think AI won’t impact your business or your people — you’re wrong. It already has.

Most of it is happening outside your line of sight — in side tools, in shadow usage, in shifting expectations.

✅ The good news? We’re still early.
 ⚠️ The bad news? Wait much longer, and you’ll be playing catch-up — on productivity, on talent, on trust.
📌 Now is the time to move — strategically, responsibly, and boldly.

Is 
hashtag
#chatgpt making everyone feel 
hashtag
#inauthentic

Is ChatGPT making everyone feel really inauthentic??? 😳

🤖 Am I speaking to you... or your AI?

📧 Old emails: “hi mate, quick one…”
📧 New emails: “Greetings Steven, I trust this email finds you well as we forge ahead…”

Same sender, totally different planet.

When I can’t hear your real voice, my brain files the message under ‘Probably Auto‑Generated’.

So if AI improves your grammar but destroys your authenticity, you’re better off without it.

Humans make mistakes, they’re imperfect, unique and distinct - that’s what makes them human. So if you show up with perfect, AI-made, cookie-cutter communication, you’re removing the meaning from your message.

📈 The rise of the LONG—————DASH

People are frequently using words and punctuation today, that I never heard 2 years ago.

In 2025, the simplest authenticity test for a paragraph is it’s “em dash” (—) count. 

I don’t even know where that long dash lives on a keyboard, but it seems to be in every email I receive.

People weren’t emailing me casually using words like “forge”, “paradigm”, “robust”, “revolutionary”, to discuss trivial issues. 

It’s funny that we can spot AI in someone else’s words, yet don’t realise everyone else can see it in ours.

🫀 The best communicators will SPEAK WITHOUT AI

If ChatGpt is churning out the same perfect text on every email, post and caption, than maybe the most resonant, impactful and powerful writers will be those that break the rules, get creative with grammar and embrace their typos. 

Human‑sounding text will carry a premium because scarcity drives value, and raw voices are fast becoming the rarest commodity online.

Save AI for spell‑check...

And when the message matters.... the pitch, the apology, the love note....spend the extra energy, and speak for yourself!

Credit: Steven Bartlett

Just published my latest Figma plugin, Repeatr. Built completely using Chatgpt✨

It's a creative playground for designers to generate patterns, flow fields, and abstract forms from a single shape.

Draw a shape / select a vector → Run Repeatr → Pick a preset → Tweak the sliders → A visual explosion unfolds on your canvas.

👉 Try it here: https://lnkd.in/gZTpFb9E

 Would love to see what you create with it! Pushing pixels into poetry :)

🧠 I asked ChatGPT about my car lease. It gave me the wrong car, a new name, and a fake bank.

In short:
📄 Scanned ≠ readable
 🔍 No OCR = no understanding
 🤐 No alerts = dangerous trust

If your AI tools are handling contracts, specs, or invoices, make sure they’re built to:
✅ Check document type
✅ Run OCR when needed
✅ Validate input before prompting
✅ Fail loudly, not silently
✅ Use structured metadata, not just raw files

Before you trust a model’s answer, ask yourself: Did it even see the right input?
Because when LLMs fly blind, they don’t crash…

They improvise.

---

Check the full story from out CTO Jedrek Fulara, PhD 👇

My first custom ChatGPT agent!✌🏽 OpenAI‘s GenAI offering now has a fully functional mock IPL auction and virtual tournament GPT application, built by yours truly!😁

I have been working on the capabilities of GenAI solutions for enterprise driven use cases for the past year & half and the one thing that has constantly fascinated me is how the technology has allowed us to curate and customise wonderful agents and applications by training models and teaching it to perform dynamic actions.

It wasn’t long before I decided to get my hands dirty and start building these agents myself! And where best to start with than cricket! Merging passion with learning, I have released this agent which was intially supposed to be just a mock IPL auction game but has since evolved to become a full fledged game, where you can play the role of a team owner (build your own star-studded team), captain your team for simuated match situations with other GPT owned teams! How cool is that!😎

I have been testing and fine-tuning the agent and have also asked a few of my friends and colleagues to test and share their feedbacks!

Would love for all of you also to give it a try and share your feedbacks to enhance the game!🙌🏼 Find the link below and go fullfill your childhood fantasy!👏🏼💯

Looking forward to building more such agents!


https://lnkd.in/g7GekbqQ
